definition: to warm up (sports)/(fig.) to prepare/to get in condition
to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

sentences.english: Overly long warm-ups coupled with runs for punishment.
sentences.chinese: 過長時間的熱身再加上懲罰式的跑步。

sentences.english: Take the vehicle on a short journey, to warm the transmission up to normal operating temperature.
sentences.chinese: 渣車行一段短路程，幫個波箱熱身去到工作溫度。

sentences.english: How Did You Get Presto TuneUp Total Doctor?
sentences.chinese: 你是如何開始普雷斯托熱身共計醫生？

sentences.english: To get you to waste $50 on the "full" version of Presto TuneUp .
sentences.chinese: 讓你浪費50元的“充分”的版本普雷斯托熱身。

sentences.english: Warm-ups and cool-downs generally involve doing your activity at a slower pace and reduced intensity.
sentences.chinese: 熱身和降溫通常是以較慢的步伐和強度來鍛鍊。

sentences.english: Yesterday, as a warm-up exercise before class so I can stretch out the legs.
sentences.chinese: 昨天上課之前的熱身運動使我今天的腿都不能伸直。

sentences.english: Bending knees and bouncing in the modern dance hangover stretch increases the warm-up.
sentences.chinese: 彎曲的膝蓋和在現代舞蹈解酒伸展彈跳增加熱身。

sentences.english: He said he would be the first person to dive during the warm-up.
sentences.chinese: 他說他將是第一個在熱身時使用魚躍救球的人。

sentences.english: Be sure to begin each workout with a brisk five-minute warm-up walk.
sentences.chinese: 確保在開始每次訓練前都要做5分鐘的熱身運動。

sentences.english: Athletes often swing their arms and warm up before a game.
sentences.chinese: 運動員常常在比賽之前揮動手臂進行熱身運動。

sentences.english: I do a long warm-up before the practice begins, a 20-minute warm-up, and that’s when I first wear them during the warm up.
sentences.chinese: 那是我在熱身運動時第一次穿上新的運動鞋。

sentences.english: If your muscles are still sore after your warm-up, try some easy stretching.
sentences.chinese: 如果熱身後肌肉仍然痠痛，試着做些簡單伸展。

sentences.english: Senderos played in most of the build-up matches.
sentences.chinese: 他倆在熱身賽中的表現如何？

sentences.english: The candidates are already limbering up for the election campaign.
sentences.chinese: 各候選人已經在爲競選運動熱身了。

sentences.english: A warm-up show by a group of dancers and Pun in Oil Street Art Village.
sentences.chinese: 一個由潘德恕和一羣舞者在藝術村的熱身表演。

sentences.english: Do you know the danger of swimming without warm-up?
sentences.chinese: 你知道不做熱身運動就下水的危險性嗎？

definition: to enter the venue/to enter the arena/(aviation) to approach the airfield/(investing) to get into the market
to compete/competition/match/to surpass/better than/superior to/to excel
preparation/to prepare/to intend/to be about to/reserve (fund)
competition schedule/the course of a race
